description.narrative: Fiber@Home (the Company) is a Bangladesh based wholesale fiber optic network developer and operator company. In 2009, the Company was awarded the first private nationwide telecommunication transmission network (NTTN) license by the Bangladesh Telecommunication Regulatory Commission (BTRC). The Company has since developed over 48,000 km of fiber optic cable (FOC) in the country across both metro city regions and cross-country networks. The proposed investment supports the Company to 1) further expand its FOC network, 2) increase network capacity through the upgradation of active equipment, 3) provide network resilience via the development of redundancy at key network nodes, and also 4) funding general working capital needs, including the development of related businesses such as data-centers (the Project).

Increased broadband network capacity in a segment of the broadband network, i.e. transmission, that is important to allow other market players to increase the coverage and bandwidth of the terrestrial network that delivers internet access to end-users, including government offices, public schools and hospitals as well as businesses. The project will also support the expansion of shared broadband infrastructure via competition in the wholesale transmission market, potentially enabling cost savings that could be passed through to end-users in terms of lower retail price and resulting into higher uptake and usage of broadband internet.

name.narrative: The project involves the expansion of Fiber@Homes nationwide network across the entire country of Bangladesh, with a focus on improving access to currently underserved regions and expansion of services to the community level. The Company is headquartered in Dhaka, with regional offices across the entire country for network expansion and maintenance.
